title: What is JSON Schema
content: JSON Schema is a vocabulary used to describe and validate the structure of JSON data. It defines what properties an object can have, their types, required fields, and more.

content.definition: Defines the data type (e.g., string, number, object, array).
Lists the fields inside an object, each with their own schema.
Marks which fields must be present.
Human-readable explanation of what a field represents.
Defines a set of allowed values.
Specifies additional constraints like email or date-time.
